name: A New Challenge
description: The Berlin Stock Market has crashed, and its effects are to be felt all around the globe. Its seismic waves have reached Paraguay, and now we have to deal with the enormous damage caused by this economic earthquake. The economy has suffered greatly, so nothing short of radical reforms will help.

name: Self Sufficiency
description: Paraguay's economy is in shambles, but its potential isn't. We should mobilize our budget to start massive industrial, agricultural and infrastructural projects. Paraguay's economy shall become self-sufficient so that we can exploit its full potential.

name: Building Industry
description: While South America, in general, has an undeveloped industrial base, Paraguay's industry is even weaker. We need to construct new industrial complexes and for industrial purposes suited railways and roads to develop our industrial base.

name: Civil Industry Incentives
description: The state is mighty and powerful, but it can't do everything by itself either. We need to promote private enterprises and investments so that our industry can grow faster. Surely, if we give investors advantages, they will invest in our economy.

name: Agricultural Effort
description: A strong industrial base is vital for a modern economy, but we shouldn't ignore all those who won't build toasters, tanks and trucks. We need to set up agricultural subsidies and agricultural institutions which help our rural farming population.

name: Protectionism
description: Our economy doesn't only suffer from underdevelopment, it also suffers from cheap foreign competition. How are we supposed to sell our goods if foreign goods are cheaper? We need to protect our economy from the evil world!

name: Import Substitution Program
description: A self-sufficient economy can't rely on imports, that's self-explanatory. We should find ways to avoid importing goods, we need to substitute everything that isn't made in Paraguay.

name: Industrialist Advances
description: Thanks to both the state and the people, our economy is quickly developing. Factories now stand there where nothing had stood before, and 'Made in Paraguay' is now omnipresent in our shops. Our industry is advancing quickly, and so should our technology.

name: Industrial Self Sufficiency
description: Our self-sufficiency plan works, that's for sure! Paraguay's economy now relies much less on imports and our manufacturing section is growing daily. 'Made in Paraguay' really does work.

name: Slash The Budget
description: Our state spends too much money, way too much money. We need to make cuts everywhere and anywhere if we wish to avoid bankruptcy. Most Paraguayans, from bureaucrats to veterans, won't be too happy with this, but we don't want to end up like the French in 1789, now do we?

name: National Liberalism
description: The state can't play god, that is a sad reality. Instead of handing over the economy to the bureaucrats, we need to liberalize it in favour of private enterprise and economic freedom.

name: Export Focused Economy
description: The Paraguayan market is quite small, but the German market isn't. In order to maximize the strength and the profits of the Paraguayan economy, we need to augment the exportation of Paraguayan goods to the whole world.

name: Increase Mining Yields
description: The mining sector is relatively small, but even then the Chaco still has quite important resource deposits. We need to increase the productivity of the mining sector so that we can export more primary resources.

name: Cut Veteran's Pensions
description: The pensions paid to the veterans of Paraguay are simply too high for the state to support. We need to cut their pensions, even if this will severely anger all those affected.

name: Cut Military Incentives
description: Our military is quite enormous in comparison to the state. Our military spending is far too high, and it has not stopped rising. We need to cut military incentives before our state collapses under the burden of the military budget.

name: Intensified Propaganda
description: In these times of troubles, it is much easier for illegal groups and foreign rivals to destabilize Paraguay. We can't let anyone slander the name of our great nation, and we can't let anyone believe the lies of the enemy.

name: Outwards Solution
description: Now that our country stands weakened by the crisis, foreigners are glaring at Paraguay, waiting for any display of weakness in our borders to strike. We will focus our propaganda on the foreign threat until we are back on our feet, just in case one of them decides to strike first

name: The Estigarribato
description: Our nation has suffered under political crises for far too long. It is time for our great leader to finally step in and protect the people of Paraguay from internal and external threats. Long live president Estigarribia!

name: National Heroics
description: Our nation is a nation of heroes, a nation filled with the greatest people of history. We should never forget the people who fought for our freedom, protected our institutions, and advanced Paraguay to the beautiful nation that it is today.

name: Constitutional Review
description: Our constitution hinders the progress of Paraguay. We should do some changes here and there to protect the people of Paraguay from every threat! We are totally not just removing all the parts which are supposed to stop a dictatorship from forming.

name: Army First Policy
description: The army of Paraguay has always served the people, has always protected them and has always fought with loyalty and strength. Our army should get priority in the new, better Paraguay.

name: Guardians of the Nation
description: Pieces of papers don't protect a nation, its military does! Our army loyally serves Paraguay to guard and protect it from any threat, internal or external.

name: Paraguayan Union State
description: Our nation isn't a 'military dictatorship' like some politicians call it, it's a union of the people, the military, the state, every part of Paraguay! The Paraguayan state has never been this united.

name: Paraguay First
description: Our nation is the best, the greatest nation in the world! Our nation has priority in front of all the nations which aren't Paraguay. Our nation shall always be first place!

name: Paz y Justicia
description: Paraguay has never been this stable, this well-protected, this united. Our new, better regime has introduced Paraguay to a never-ending period of peace and stability.

name: Defensores Del Chaco
description: Our beautiful nation has significantly grown in the last years at the cost of Bolivia. Our glorious soldiers have proven their strength and will on the battlefield, but now it's time to consolidate our gains. The Chaco will forever remain Paraguayan!

name: Doctrine Review
description: A major army reformation is required to defend our vast country. One of the most important things a modern army needs is a definite, efficient military doctrine. We need to overhaul ours to ensure that our army will win every battle.

name: Garra Guarani
description: Our soldiers have proven their strength and will on the battlefields of the Chaco! Our army is made for capturing land, not for letting the enemy capture our land. We need an offensive-minded doctrine!

name: Offensive Mentality
description: Our glorious soldiers shouldn't waste their time and lives in some dirty trenches or bunkers infested with rats. We need to always have the initiative and always be on the offensive to win the future wars.

name: Continous Offensives
description: We cannot let the enemy reorganize and consolidate their forces after one of our successful offensives. We must attack them until we arrive in their capitals so that they will never have time to rest.

name: Mobile Force
description: Our army is focused on offensives and mobility, but simple infantry is rather unsuited for the latter. We need to create special mobile forces that shall be the fastest units on the battlefield.

name: Unrelenting Force
description: We shall not let our enemy rest! However, that means we won't be able to rest either. Our army shall attack with an unrelenting force so that the enemy will crumble!

name: Close Air Support Tactics
description: It is rather difficult for any army, even the glorious Paraguayan army, to continuously fight battles after battles. We need to support our men on the ground with specialized aircraft.

name: Superior Firepower
description: Our nation doesn't have as many fighting-able men as Argentina or Brazil, so we need to compensate our low manpower with high firepower. Let's adopt a doctrine focusing on superior firepower and combat strength.

name: Artillery Battalions
description: The artillery piece is vital to increase the firepower of our army. We need to create special artillery battalions that will blow up the enemy wherever they might be.

name: Spotters & Scouts
description: There is one major issue with long-range artillery pieces: If we don't know where exactly the enemy is, we will just blow up a few squirrels. We need spotters and scouts that can accurately report the position of the enemy.

name: Concentrated Fire
description: A single artillery piece can kill a few soldiers with a perfect hit, but fifty artillery pieces can destroy a whole battalion with some decent hits. We need to concentrate our firepower for maximum effectiveness.

name: Doctrine Advances
description: Reinventing our doctrine is a long, costly process. We need to further advance our military doctrine so that our army will effectively fight on any battlefield.

name: Shock & Awe
description: Speed is the key to all modern war. It must be the main focus of our army if we are to defend our national borders.

name: Military Science
description: The process of reinventing our military doctrine was long and exhausting as we were missing enough theorists and military experts. We should invest more in military science to avoid this situation from happening again.

name: Caballeros del Chaco
description: Many Paraguayans have shown their excellent strength, will and resilience. We should honour these war heroes, as they are some of the finest people in the world!

name: Motorisation Experiments
description: New combat weapons have made their debut during the Weltkrieg, be it the tank, the armoured car or motorized transport vehicles. We should invest in these new weapons as they will serve Paraguay well.

name: Logistical Expertise
description: One of the largest Bolivian shortcomings during the Chaco War was their supply system, as their communication and supply lines were inadequate. We should learn from their mistakes so we don't repeat them.

name: The New Army
description: Our glorious army won against Bolivia, but many doubt that we will win against Argentina or Brazil, who both own lands that are rightfully ours. We need to modernize and professionalize our army.

name: Improved Equipment
description: Our equipment is rather outdated, which gives us a disadvantage on the battlefield. We need to modernize and improve them to keep up with the armies of our rivals.

name: Boots on the Ground, Rifles on Hand
description: A problem facing our army is how many of our troops have outdated equipment or no equipment at all. We must move forward to newer tech options, and try to increase production.

name: Production Capacity
description: It is the sad truth that our military-industrial complex is smaller than that of Argentina or Brazil, but that doesn't mean it has to stay that way. We need to invest more in our production capacities.

name: Army Railways
description: A large issue that the Bolivian army faced in the Chaco War was the lack of proper infrastructure suited for military usage. We should not make the same mistake: We need to construct railways suited for military transportation.

name: Intensify Military Production
description: Our new railways have a large transportation capacity, but if our production capacity is low, we will not be able to use these railways. We need to increase the production of military equipment.

name: Every Woman a Worker
description: Our male adult population is quite small in comparison to that of our neighbours, and our army is taking up more and more of them. To fill the factories, we need to get women into the workforce.

name: Army-State Cooperation
description: Prussia has often been referred to as an army with a state. If any nation is the equivalent of Prussia, it is beautiful Paraguay. We should increase the cooperation between the army and the state.

name: Superior Training
description: Unlike the veterans of the Chaco War, the new recruits have little actual combat experience. We need to improve our training to keep a relatively high standard of experience in our army.

name: Special Forces
description: The terrain of our nation isn't the same as the flat fields of Flanders. Made up of jungles, forests and hills with poor infrastructure, the terrain forces us to have units specialized in fighting in it.

name: Every Man a Soldier
description: Our population is roughly one million. In comparison, Argentina is the home of almost fourteen million. We need as many men as possible to fill our army if we wish to reclaim our rightful lands.

name: Militarism
description: In order to sustain our army, we need to increase the militarism of our population. Frequent parades, school books glorifying the military... We should employ every available method!

name: No Pasaran!
description: Every man in Paraguay knows how to handle a rifle, and is willing to employ his knowledge if the enemy dares to advance in our sacred land. The enemy shall pay in blood for every meter of Paraguayan land he conquers.

name: Armoured Warfare
description: The enemy will be able to kill a soldier, render an artillery piece useless and destroy a truck, but he will not be able to destroy a mighty Paraguayan tank.

name: An Army With No Equal
description: Nowhere in the world, not even in 19th century Prussia, has an army been so well integrated into the state that it forms a union with the other national institutions. Nothing is as mighty as our armed forces.

name: Further Production Capabilities
description: Every soldier needs a rifle, a uniform and various other weapons and equipment. We need to further increase our military production capabilities to adequately arm our army.

name: General Staff Review
description: Our army has greatly expanded, but our general staff has been lacking behind in personnel. We need to review our general staff to increase its command capacity and effectiveness.

name: Fortress Asuncion
description: The most beautiful city of the world is not Berlin, not Paris, not Madrid, but Asunción! We shall turn it into an unconquerable fortress so that the Paraguayan flag will always remain on top of the city hall.

name: Extend Special Forces Training
description: Specialised units always require more training than their ordinary counterparts. We need to increase the effectiveness of the training so that more soldiers can effectively fight as members of a specialised unit.

name: Defenders of the Sky
description: Our beautiful blue sky is the home of many rare birds, but sadly our enemy doesn't seem to respect its quietness. We need to form a professional air force to defend the Paraguayan sky!

name: Bomber Aircraft
description: If we gain air superiority, the enemy industrial areas will lie virtually undefended against an aerial attack. We need large aircraft with a significant payload to exploit this weakness to its full effect.

name: Low Altitude Craft
description: Industry and infrastructure aren't the only bombing targets there are, enemy units are also great targets. In order to effectively weaken enemy forces, we need more agile low flying bomber aircraft.

name: Strategic Destruction
description: A single bomb can destroy a piece of rail with a lucky hit, but one thousand bombs are guaranteed to destroy the entire railway hub. We shall rain havoc on our enemies from the sky!

name: Air Force Staff
description: Our air force is quite young, and despite the usage of aircraft during the Chaco War, its staff is still very inexperienced. We need to expand and improve our air force staff.

name: Airplane Experiments
description: So far, our aircraft are mostly outdated imports. We need to experiment more with modern designs to improve our aircraft industry and our air force in general.

name: Fighter Aircraft
description: If we wish to use bombers and close air support aircraft effectively, we need to first achieve air superiority. We need specialized fighter aircraft to intercept and destroy enemy planes.

name: Long Range Fighters
description: Our fighters will be able to secure the air around our borders, but the most important bombing targets remain largely outside the range of ordinary fighters. We need larger fighters that are capable of longer flights!

name: Long Range Capabilities
description: Most of the industrial centres of our future enemies lie far away from Paraguay, be it Buenos Aires, La Paz or Rio de Janeiro. Our air force needs to be equipped with long-range aircraft.

name: Foreign Advisers
description: Even the greatest of nations, our beautiful Paraguay, sometimes needs help from other nations. We have no choice but to invite foreign advisers to help build up our air force.

name: Aerial Supremacy
description: The sky, just like the ground, will be controlled by Paraguay! No enemy aircraft shall ever reach Asunción! Now we just need to find a way to control the sea as well...

name: Colorado Resurgence
description: The last Colorado president Paraguay has had was in 1912 with Pedro Pablo Peña who was deposed very quickly. This has left our country with a nearly unchallenged Liberal rule for decades. However, broken promises from the liberals and an ailing economy are leaving many Paraguayans disillusioned. We shall reach out to the common Paraguayan and offer them the solutions the Liberals didn't give them.

name: True Values
description: The Colorados has always been a conservative party. During the liberal governments, the Paraguayan populace was forced through several progressive reforms which many didn't agree with. Now that we're in power, we shall take steps to protect our nation's traditional and familiar values to secure our society for a better, more stable tomorrow.

name: Loyal & Faithful
description: The Paraguayan people have proven their loyalty and faithfulness during these last few decades, especially with the Chaco War. Such virtues shall be encouraged to all our citizens to make every Paraguayan a paragon of these various virtues that have brought greatness to our country.

name: Fixing the Mess
description: The Liberals have left us with a messy budget. While we may have won the Chaco War, government spending has made this victory short-lived as the spoils of war we gained have been quickly spent. We now have the task of balancing the budget by ourselves.

name: Prosperity and Progress
description: We Colorados know that the only way forward for our country is with hard work. We have to focus this spirit towards achieving economic prosperity and progress, that way we shall both be true to our ideals and help our country get back on its feet.

name: Correcting Social Mistakes
description: The Alianza Nacional Republicana may be a conservative party, but we are by no mean backwards or oppressive! We have been informed of several issues that plague our citizens' social life, and we intend to correct these issues left by the previous administrations.

name: Individual Freedoms
description: The Liberals had a mouthful of how their progressive reforms were helping the country. They proved to be unreliable and treacherous. We shall champion individual values and begin legal reforms to include individual freedoms into our current law code.

name: Ban Traitor Parties
description: While most political entities in our country supported the government during the Chaco campaign, there were other despicable forces who hindered our efforts. We shall begin a major crackdown on their activities and ban their parties, as a punishment for their lack of loyalty to the country.

name: Stable Rule
description: Paraguay is rather uneventful compared to the rest of the world. We Paraguayans enjoy the calm we have achieved in our country and as such, will do our best to keep a stable rule in our country, trying to avoid radical reforms or big social changes.

name: Colorado Hegemony
description: The Colorados used to be an insignificant force in liberal Paraguay. However, after our many reforms, there's no denying that our party has become Paraguay's most popular party. While we do defend democracy and republicanism, there's nothing wrong with us taking advantage of our hegemony to push our agendas a bit more in the country.

name: Army Support
description: Now that we're in power, we realize that many within the army share our views and are more than willing to support us. This shall give us another layer of safety in the unlikely case of a coup or a war. In exchange, however, we shall leave the military budget alone, since they will need that money to invest in our protection.

name: Continued Military Incentives
description: While our military spending is currently satisfactory, South America has turned into a dangerous place. We shall expand our military incentives to have a battle-ready army for whatever threat we might face.

name: Protectors of Paraguay
description: Our nation stands on the brink of catastrophe! We shall step in and restore order because Paraguay needs protection and we must answer our country's call!

name: For the Army, by the Army
description: Opportunist politicians have taken advantage of the victories our army made during the Chaco War to further their dubious agendas. We will not stand for it any longer! We shall tune the state machine to serve the army's purposes and force it to fulfil our agendas.

name: Witch Hunts
description: First and foremost we will have to secure our position. We're not the only ones who want to take power in Paraguay, and we're well aware of Rafael Franco's efforts to come back from exile and transform our society into a godless syndicalist state. We shall begin a major search for syndicalist elements in our society to reduce the chance of a syndicalist counter-coup.

name: Weed Out Traitors
description: There are many within our society that are plotting against us as we speak that aren't aligned with the syndicalists. We need to strike them first if we want to preserve our nation's integrity! We shall begin a major search for traitors in our populace until every Paraguayan has had their loyalties checked.

name: Our Grand Destiny
description: Paraguay was a regional power before we were beaten by a treacherous coalition between Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina, which almost erased Paraguay from existence. However, we survived, and now we that we stand stronger than ever, we shall reclaim what was once rightfully ours!

name: Our Legacy
description: Democratic governments have the major flaw of governing in short terms, always thinking on making reforms to gain popularity rather than leaving a righteous legacy. We will not be hindered by such mentality, and begin major reforms in order for our legacy to never be forgotten.

name: Faith and State
description: Our country has many strong social virtues, but one of the most cherished is faith. While we're by no means a monarchy ruled from Rome by the pope, we cannot deny the Catholic influence within our country, and we'd do well in taking advantage of our country's faith by allowing the Catholic church to play a larger role in our government as long as it doesn't hinder our power.

name: Grand National Heroes
description: The soldiers who fought in the Chaco War have been revered by the previous governments. While we consider their efforts fitting, we also believe that they are not enough. Our soldiers are an example of the kind of citizen we need to make our country great, and we shall publicize this image so all Paraguayans know that becoming a soldier is an honour and a duty for everyone.

name: Guarani Nationalism
description: Our country has been a slave to foreigners long enough! We shall exalt nationalism in our society, so that every Paraguayan truly believes his country is better than our decadent neighbours and is willing to defend this superiority, through violence if necessary!

name: Guarani Self Sufficiency
description: The only way we will truly be free from foreign slavers will be by achieving total self-sufficiency. Our forefathers were able to achieve it when Solano Lopez was in power, and we shall do so again! Even if that means we'll have to fight the Triple Alliance again.

name: An Army with a State
description: The Paraguayan state will not survive in this hostile continent without a strong military power that keeps the dangers away. As such, we should recognize the fact that our existence is dependant on the strength of our armed forces, and by extension, it's the state that serves the armed forces, and not the other way around.

name: Enemies on All Sides
description: Our country has had a very troubled history. Our innocence was taken away when all our neighbours turned against us in both in the Chaco War and the Triple Alliance War. As such, we shall blind ourselves no further. Paraguay has enemies on all sides and we will recognize them all as threats to our very existence, and so will our people.

name: Abrilist Recovery
description: Back in 1934, we launched a successful coup and retook our country for the people. Unfortunately, we were deposed shortly after, but now we are stronger than before, and this time, we will be victorious!

name: Military Revolution
description: Rafael Franco, before becoming a revolutionary, was a very influential figure within the army. While his short-lived coup and exile have soured his relations with the most conservative officers, many of his supporters come from the army itself who just wish to take Paraguay into a better future, and as such, are willing to help us in our revolution!

name: National Revolution
description: We have secured power in Asunción, but we still have to take over the rest of the country. Onwards men! The workers of our country still need us!

name: Our Comrades
description: The Chileans and Argentineans are our comrades in arms. They helped us to free ourselves from the tyranny of the oligarchs and imperialists, and we shall recognize their efforts and proclaim our friendship towards them.

name: Historical Revisionism
description: For years we've been forced to falsely believe that our country was inferior to others when in reality Solano Lopez had almost made us into a world power! We shall begin a massive process of revisionism and we shall rewrite all history books so that forever we shall remember his exploits as a patriotic move against foreign imperialists.

name: Permanent Revolution
description: Had the Chileans turned our back to us, we wouldn't have been able to achieve our revolution. Following their example, we shall impose ourselves the duty of helping out our fellow revolutionaries in the world so that the fires of revolution may never be snuffed out by tyrants.

name: The People's Vanguard
description: Our army is a precious tool, but if they are corrupted by foreign entities, we don't currently have anything with what to protect us. We shall invest in creating a People's Vanguard, as a way to keep the army in check and protect us in the case of counter-revolution.

name: Socialist Nationalism
description: While we do agree with our fellow socialists in many regards, we Paraguayans don't believe in internationalism. Our country is our family, and their countries are their families. As such, we shall take pride in being Paraguayans even if the other socialists don't appreciate our patriotism.

name: Second Paraguayan Socialist Golden Age
description: In 1934, the very few months we managed to govern were crucial for our popularity. We made many social reforms that have helped the common worker in Paraguay, creating a short-lived but appreciated golden age. Now that we have consolidated our power, it is only right that we should go back to the reforms we made back then and create a new golden age for the worker. This time, permanently.

name: Extend the Chairman's Power
description: Rafael Franco has become a national hero like Solano Lopez was before our time. Like Lopez, now Franco has requested we extend his executive power to give his personal guidance to the nation. How could we reject such a proposition?
